tutorial.title: Online Text Editor
tutorial.descriptionContent: Create a simple user interface for text editing using JavaScript

executableContent.instructions:
In this project, we'll work on creating an online text editor. Try typing a word in the large text area below. Then click a button to see the font style change.

Let's look at what we will start off with. 

- There is an `index.html` file with some starting code. 
- The html contains an `input` element that will be used as the main text area of the editor. 
- There is a `style.css` file with a few predefined styles.
- There is an empty `script.js` file.

1. Find the `input` element in the `index.html` file.
2. Give this input the ID `"words"`.

Remember that `querySelectorAll` returns an array. Access the first element by index, like this:

```JS
document.querySelectorAll("input")[0]
```
Assign the color to the elements style like this:

```JS
el.style.color = input.value;
```

1. In the `removeFormat` function, add a call to `el.classList.remove`
2. Pass in four parameters:  `"underline"`, `"italic"`, `"bold"`, and `"mono"`.
